DataElement.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Pathologic T Stage Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the pathologic T stage cancer that develops in the lining of the renal tubules, which filter the blood and produce urine.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Pathologic T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pathologic T stage cancer that develops in the lining of the renal tubules, which filter the blood and produce urine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that develops in the lining of the renal tubules, which filter the blood and produce urine.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma.  There is a strong correlation between cigarette smoking and the development of renal cell carcinoma.  The clinical presentation includes : hematuria, flank pain and a palpable lumbar mass.  A high percentage of renal cell carcinomas are diagnosed when an ultrasound is performed for other purposes.  Radical nephrectomy is the standard intervention procedure.  Renal cell carcinoma is generally considered to be resistant to radiation treatment and chemotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T0: No evidence of primary tumor

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: T0: No evidence of primary tumor

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: AREN1721 WL 7/25/2018 (unable to find matching concept codes for T0, T1a, T1b, T2a, T2b, T3a, T3b, T3c, T4)
